body: For this particular failure, I think you're hitting a known issue in gRPC's DNS resolver. The DNS resolver was changed from native to ares in the 1.19.0 release (see the `GRPC_DNS_RESOLVER` bullet in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/environment_variables.md for more details), and the new ares resolver currently doesn't retry DNS queries that timed out (e.g. caused by a dropped query or a temporarily non-responsive DNS server). As a result, a single timed out DNS query will cause the gRPC channel to switch to "transient failure" state right away (and only after that will DNS resolution be retried). Open PR: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/17688 adds retries to the resolver so should mitigate this. To be sure that that's the case, if you could run under environment variables: `GRPC_VERBOSITY=DEBUG` `GRPC_TRACE=api,cares_resolver,cares_address_sorting` and paste the log we could get a better idea. All that said, `WithWaitForReady(true)` might be a good fix for your use anyways, I can't say yet. Also, a workaround might be to run under `GRPC_DNS_RESOLVER=native`

I checked out the logs and found that the name resolution failed true.
**Sorry for that I mentioned about the server-side log, it came from another client.  In addition, I passed the variable incorrectly. I am very sorry to bother you.**

Anyway, below are the logs.

This log is shown when using _ares_
